-I was hoping that the Galaxy Watch would allow me to leave my phone in my locker at the gym, and that I'd be able to use the watch to (1) play music, (2) track my workout, and (3) connect to wifi so I can send/receive texts/emails
-The good news is that the watch is capable of doing all of that with no lag – even when running music + wifi + S health continuous HR monitoring + gymrun
-The bad news is that the watch can’t connect to captive portal wifi (networks that require you to visit a website and accept terms), and that  the watch burns through appx 30% battery in an hour if you do all of that
-The floors-climbed counter is mixed; it's sometimes quite accurate but sometimes misses floors Style, comfort, and build
-I'm a male of above average height, and the 42mm watch face is right size for me; there are online watch face size calculators based on wrist size – you’d have to have quite large wrists for a larger watch to look ‘appropriate’
-Of course style is subjective and some prefer a larger face, but for me, 42mm is as large as I was willing to go, and the availability of a 42mm version was a huge selling point
-The watch looks good overall; it's not the world’s best looking watch but certainly something that’s well worth wearing anywhere from the gym to the office to a night out
-The watch is thicker than I anticipated; from the side, it looks quite chunky
-It's very comfortable; I don't notice it during the day, even when typing; it doesn’t get in the way while lifting weights
-Build quality seems good so far – no dents or scratches, but it hasn’t seen hard knocks Hardware
-This is where the Galaxy Watch really shines, in 2 areas in particular: the SoC (chip that powers the watch) and the rotating bezel
-I don’t think I’ll ever use a watch without a rotating bezel; it's the best way to interact with a smartwatch by far – it allows you to navigate without blocking/smudging the screen or maneuvering both hands to spin a tiny wheel on a side button
-The SoC blows away everyone but apple; wear os watches are 2+ generations behind
-As a result, battery life is excellent (by current smartwatch standards) and apps run smoothly Software
-This is most people’s biggest complaint – not so much the OS but the limited app availability
-Tizen OS is actually quite intuitive, fluid, and customizable
-Lack of apps does not bother me – aside from the use cases I described up top, I’d rather use my phone for any other apps anyway
-But google integration is not perfect and many apps are not available; if this is something you care about, do some research about what is/is not available on the watch

I am always leary buying something used but, I took a leap of faith and ordered a 42mm watch. It was in used/like new condition. It arrived a few days after ording and as advertised it came in a white aftermarket box and contained an OEM charging block, cable and charger. Overall the watch was in good condition. There were some light surface marks on it but, I was looking for blemishes. The watch face did not have any scratches. The band which was an OEM black plastic band was a little dirty but, cleaned up by using a clorox wipe on it. It was dead so it tood a little for it to charge up. Installed the app and got everying up and running with little effort. Using it my first day I found that I still needed to tweek some of the settings. I had plenty of battery left at the end of the day. I charged it overnight and decided I wanted to see how much battery life I would have. I ended up with one full day/night and the battery took me through to a 2nd day and at 930 pm I was down to about 3% battery. I have no issue charging daily but, wanted to see if I ended up working late how much time would I have before it goes dead. My opinion is that I was satisfied with just about 2 days of use. There are an abundance of watch faces to meet everyone's needs and taste. I really wanted a more smart watch to monitor my O2 sats, heart rate, etc and this does a great job in doing that. I also set reminders if I am sedentary too long, it will prompt me to get moving. So, to those who are squeamish on buying used items take the plunge and buy it. Use the money you would have spent on a new watch on a band, screen protector, etc. I realize there are more current watches that do more but, the features on this watch checked off all of my boxes. As for the features, I find the heart rate and O2 measuring are very accurate as well as the step tracking. Very happy with this purchase!

I had a Frontier S3 that unfortunately died after 2.5 years. I loved that watch but I decided if I was going to buy a new smart watch I wanted to research all options. I didn't want an apple watch because I had their first generation watch (which was fine), I use a Samsung phone, and it seems like everyone has an apple watch. When I had my frontier I always got complements because it looks different and like a real watch. I looked at fitbit, garmin, and others and decided that I really did like the features and look of the Samsung watch best. Of course then I had to decide between the new Active and 2 different sizes of the Galaxy. I chose the Galaxy because it had the bezel and also the integrated speaker which is nice. If I didn't care about those 2 things I probably would have selected the Active. Then I debated about the size and whether to stick with the slightly large 46mm form factor the frontier had or the smaller 42mm. I went to a Verizon store to see the difference in person and landed on the smaller 42mm size. I'm really happy with it. The watch looks great, has fantastic battery life, and works really well. The SHealth app leaves a little to be desired but I think I'll look around at 3rd party alternatives. One tip - the batteries in these devices have about a 2 year lifespan. Do yourself a favor and get an extended warranty. I searched Amazon and found the ASURION 3 year personal care extended protection plan. It isn't that expensive and basically means you're covered for 4 years in total. Trust me, it's worth it. There are several variations of the protection plans so make sure to get the personal care one I've mentioned. Good luck!
Good, useful product.

product_title: Fossil Hybrid Smartwatch Q Tailor Light Brown Leather

reviews.review_body: I just received my hybrid watch. It paired with my Galaxy S7 but the notification features aren't working at all. The other features work like the music and camera but I  bought it for the notification features. Very disappointed!

It is a cool and fashionable watch, YET the fossil app does not play well with android software. It took me four months to figure out that their app was causing the android software to become unstable on my phone and tablet after reloading the software several times and trial and error with all my apps.

I Love this watch.  Being a professional, i needed something that looked nice. Did not want one I had to charge all the time, and really was only looking for message and call notifications so I didn't have to carry my phone around always. This serves the purpose, plus. The vibrations are not real strong, but I found if I wear it looser on my wrist like a bracelet, I feel it better as it rests near my hand. After reading other reviews about the band getting dirty, I initially sprayed the band with a leather protector  that's worked beautifully.  Would definitely recommend.

I got this watch for Christmas, having been in the market for a Fossil Q hybrid for a while, and I love it. It's stylish and I can still track my steps when away from my phone. Keep in mind it doesn't monitor heart rate if that is something you are in the market for. It also has the potential to monitor sleep, but I can just see myself shattering the watch face while tossing and turning, so I don't take advantage of that one. The band on this model is a very light leather so this model will get dirtier quicker than the others. My only warning is that as this is a normal watch battery, having all the fancy text notifications and whatnot will run the battery down quicker. This is a potential inconvenience, but the app does a good job at telling where the battery of the watch is. I got very nervous after going through 5% of the battery within a couple of days, but I turned off text notifications and I have been at 95% for almost a month since.
Love this watch!
Love it!!!!!
I am super bummed as it broke already
crystal cracked after 2 months, no warranty on crystal through Fossil, crap company, crap product!!!
Awesome watch my wife loved it!!
We have 4 total of the Q's. They're phenomenal.
